intro: Strychnos loandensis, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy aril. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
